instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00281 NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
Good day, guys.

I have a 15 inches 2016/17 Touch Bar with no display on internal. When I measured in DIODE MODE {{EDP_AUXCH_C_P}} signal was very low compared to a working board which led me to replace U9850 from a donor board, then checked again in Diode mode, and this time the value I got was that of a working board, but I still do not have an internal screen display. Is there something else I need to do in a situation like this aside from replacing U9850? especially given that the signal was low at first, which points to an issue in the region. Please help.

threads.title: 820-00281 NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
Tested known good LCD assembly?
Check 3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD and DP_INT_HPD presence.

threads.title: 820-00281 NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
3V3/5V_S0SW_LCD VOLTAGES ARE BOTH PRESENT 
DP_INT_HPD = PRESENT AT 3.3V

threads.title: 820-00281 NO DISPLAY ON INTERNAL SCREEN
threads.message:
So internal LCD is detected; no image for sure?

What is the backlight output voltage?
Check with LCD connected, of course.
